experience: You and Nancy both know Andrew Mason, Craig Fecteau, and 8 others
You both worked at EPIC Research and Diagnostics
You both worked at EPIC Research and Diagnostics from Feb 2011 to Aug 2013
Scanning with Body Photon Imaging technology, Health and Wellness Coaching, Energy Medicine Research Consultant, Educator for Energy Medicine and Biophysics applied to energetic modalities.
Founded EPIC Research & Diagnostics to bring my new medical imaging technology to market.

During the last three years at Mayo Clinic served on the task force to create the Program of Integrative Medicine. Once the program was approved at Mayo, served as co-chair of the new Program of Integrative Medicine. This program focused on research and education in the areas of complementary and alternative medical modalities (CAM). One of the charges of that program was to oversee the CAM  professional quality assurance program, practitioner credentialing, CAM resource networking. Also while at Mayo, in addition to clinical physics responsibilities founded a new  program to help educate cancer patients and family members about their radiation therapy. Glow Club is a class designed to help patients and their families understand what cancer is and how conventional medical therapies work to treat it. Therapies such as radiation, surgery, and chemotherapy; along with other legitimate alternative treatments are explained in detail. Glow Club was extremely popular.
Clinical Radiological Physicist - Clinical Coordinator Brachytherapy Program

Certified by COMS to do protocol patients randomized to plaque treatment and external beam.Responsible for all HDR treatments done. Calibration of HDR machine, and QA on all applicators and machine attachments.Responsible for all brachytherapy dosimetry, and QA of treatment planning unit. Beaumont utilizes the Nucletron planning system for all brachytherapy cases.Hot lab inventory maintenance, and QA of sources and the necessary equipment.QA, loading, building of sources, and treatment utilization of Nucletron's LDR microSelectrons.	Aid in the development and implementation of new clinical procedures and protocols in the clinic.Radiation Safety Officer designee.

•	Accelerator calibrations: Maintain accurate calibration of treatment units according to  protocol and existing departmental policies.Equipment quality assurance:  Maintain routine quality assurance program for the treatment units and simulators.  Includes day-to-day responsibility for daily assurance checks.
Clinical Radiation Therapy Physicist and Radiation Safety Officer

I was incredibly fortunate to have had Professor Emeritus William A. Tiller, of Stanford University’s Department of Materials Science as my dissertation advisor, and Dr. Norm Shealy, world-renowned experts in their respective fields of biophysical science and energy medicine. Dissertation: PARALLEL INVESTIGATION OF THE MERIDIAN STRESS ASSESSMENT (MSA-21) AND THE GAS DISCHARGE VISUALIZATION DEVICES:  CAN THEY MEASURE THE EFFECTS OF ACUPUNCTURE TREATMENT ON THE BODY’S ENERGY STATE?  Determined levels of sensitivities of these types of equipment to energy movement of the body. Although this school/program was not accredited, and is touted as a charlatan school it was being headed at the time, by Dr. Norm Shealy, the father of holistic medicine, a man way ahead of his time in medicine. It offered the opportunity to do research with outstanding leaders in their field to promote a new way to understand the energy of the body. Dr. Norm Shealy went on to found Holos University.
Are There Electrical Devices that can Measure the body
Are There Electrical Devices that can Measure the body

recommendations: I was introduced to Nache about 3 years ago, and he initially impressed me with his knowledge of like technologies and his thoughts on the future of medicine. He has very good communication skills, and professional demeanor. Nache was initially hired as our lead engineer and it was quickly apparent that he had the skills and outlook to be more than a lead engineer and I promoted him to VP of Engineering. He is thoughtful and has incredible attention to detail. He is forward thinking and can lead a team toward successful outcomes. Nache takes the initiative to learn when and where it is required and to teach. He can create a cohesive and inspired team environment.  Nache is reliable, dedicated and an objective thinker. His ability to remain steady in the face of frustrating circumstances and setbacks was greatly valued by me and our entire team at EPIC. Organized and diligent, Nache quickly learned the EPIC technology hardware and software system that were unfamiliar to him when he first started with EPIC. Nache is a hardworking, top-performing engineering professional. He has my highest recommendation; I only wish we could continue to work together. Sincerely,Nancy R. Rizzo, MS, DABR, Ph.D.

April 18, 2016, Nancy was senior to Raghu but didn’t manage directly

Raghu is an amazing and talented software engineer who produced great results for EPIC. Raghu took on more responsibility and lead our team of engineers in a creative and determined fashion. Raghu is able to think out of the box to arrive at unique solutions enabling our software to advance to its next level. Raghu has always gone above and beyond his specific duties to support the company and helping our technology reach its goals. I heartily recommend Raghu as a Director of Software Engineering. He is amazing and I would hire in again in a nano-second. Raghu will be a tremendous asset to whomever he decides to support.Nancy R. Rizzo,
